title.rendered: Apply Now | Nipissing University Admission Requirements 2024

content.rendered:
Nipissing University Admission Necessities,Documents required for admission,English Language Proficiency Requiredments maximum admission necessities for canadian secondary school students.

Nipissing University Admission is ongoing for all interested candidates who wish to apply the admission is open for all nationals.

Nipissing University Admission necessities

Maximum Admission necessities from Canadian Secondary School and Quebec CEGEP Students

Alberta/Northwest Territories/Nunavut

  • English grade of 30 or ELA 30-1 plus four Grade 12 courses numbered 30 or 31

British Columbia/Yukon

  • English grade of 12 in addition to three other academic Grade scores of 12 courses (courses with % grades do not letter grades). A regional exam is not essential.

Manitoba

  • English grade of the 40S in addition to four other Grade scores of 12 courses at the 40 levels.

New Brunswick

  • English grade of 121 or 122 in addition to four other academic Grade of 12 courses numbered 121 or 122 (courses numbered 120 could be considered).

Newfoundland

  • The English grade of 3201 (2 credits) in addition to five two-credit academic courses at 3000 levels.

Maya Scotia

  • English grade of 12 in addition to four extra academic or  higher Grade of 12 courses

Ontario

  • ENG4U in addition to the other five 4U and/or 4M courses

Prince Edward Island

  • English 621 in addition to the other four Grade 12 courses numbered 611 or 621

Quebec

  • One year of CEGEP accomplished with a bare minimum of 12 academic subjects as well as English

Note Applicants from Quebec who have accomplished more than one year of CEGEP (more than 12 academic courses) will be measured for admittance with higher standing. Applicants who have completed the DEC program with a collective average of ‘B’ or better will be measured for admittance with superior standing to an utmost score of 30 credits. Prerequisite subjects can still apply for Nipissing University admission necessities.

Saskatchewan

  • English grade of A30 and B30 in addition to other four Grade 12 courses numbered 30 or 30A

For International Students Admissions

 International Admission Requirements

Fall/Winter Session – Full-time University Study

Applicants will have to apply through the Ontario Universities Application Centre (OUAC). Applications, fees, and official vital credentials have to be received by the Office of the Registrar by April 1 for the September admissions concern.

Documents Required for Nipissing University Admission

Note that: It is the duty of each applicant to submit the below-listed documents directly to the Office of the Registrar:

  1. Authorized transcripts from all institutions formerly or currently attend, for example, secondary schools, colleges, and universities;
  2. verification of name change, if academic credentials confirm a name other than that under which application is made (i.e. marriage certificate, notarized statements of the legal name change, or other legal papers); and also,
  3. Evidence of English language aptitude test, if English is not the applicant’s first language.

Applicants, who withhold, misrepresent or fail to provide information related to previous academic records may have their admission offer revoked or be required to withdraw from the University.

Proof of Proficiency in English

Requirements are as follows:

 TOEFL® Test Special Home Edition

  •  For Undergraduate/Post-Baccalaureate programs:  A maximum score of 83 with the least amount score of 20 in reading, listening, and writing, and a minimum score of 22 in speaking
  • Graduate programs:  Minimum score of 93 with a minimum score of 20 in reading and listening and a minimum score of 22 in dialogue and script.

 Duolingo English Test

  • For Undergraduate/Post-Baccalaureate programs: A  minimum  score of 110
  • In Graduate programs:  least amount  of 115

All applicants applying to Nipissing University undergraduate degree programs (excluding BEd) from countries where the dominant language of instruction is other than English are required to demonstrate aptitude in English for admission concerns.

All Permanent Resident applicants whose first language is not English may be required to offer evidence of proficiency in English. Applicants can show proficiency in one of the following ways:

  1. Completion of three or more successive years of full-time education in English within Canada directly prior to attending Nipissing University.
  2. Completion of three or more consecutive years of full-time education in English in a country other than Canada where English is the main language. These years must be immediately proceeding to attend Nipissing University.
  3. Achieve the required proficiency level on one of the following tests of English language proficiency:
    1. Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL):  minimum score of 83 (iBT) with a maximum score of 20 in reading, listening, and writing, and a minimum score of 22 in speaking. The Nipissing University TOEFL institution code is #3614
    2. International English Language Test Service (IELTS):  least amount overall band score of 6.5 with a minimum 6.5 in reading, listening, speaking, and writing.
    3. Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic:  minimum overall score of 58 with a maximum score of 56 in speaking, writing, reading, and listening.
  4. Completion of an International Baccalaureate (IB) diploma with the least amount keeps count of 5 or better in HL or SL English A: Literature or HL or SL English A: Language and Literature.
  5. Graduate from a regionally accredited US secondary school and achieve a maximum score of 4 or better in Advanced Placement (AP) English Language & Composition or English Literature & Composition.
  6. Accomplish a maximum grade of B in GCSE, IGCSE, or GCE common Level English Literature or English Language, a maximum score of C in GCE A Level or AS Level or AICE or CAPE English or English Language, or the smallest amount score of M3 in Cambridge Pre-U English.
  7. Accomplish a maximum grade score of 75% or better in the All India Senior Secondary School Certificate (ISSC) Core or efficient English or the Indian School Certificate (ISC) English, issued by the Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE).

Applicants who have met all of Nipissing University’s admission supplies excluding the English language aptitude necessity can register in an EAP curriculum. Applicants who register in one of the following programs will be given a conditional offer of admission. By effectively completing the program level indicated below, applicants can start their studies at Nipissing University without extra tests.

The UOIT English Language Centre: with Level of 5

AYJ Global EAP Program: the Highest Level

Brock University’s Intensive English Language Program: with Level of 5

Canadian as a Second Language Institute (CSLI): higher Level of 10

Capital English Solutions: College/University Preparation Course (CUPIC)

Culture Works: with Level of 7

Applicants who have successfully completed EAP programs connected with other Canadian universities and obtained that university’s bare minimum level for admission concern could also be considered to have met Nipissing University’s English language aptitude necessity.
